Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; band of perhaps maeander in added white between pairs of faded white bands; added red dot below; top of rim glazed; exterior: row of blobs at rim above Z band between dilute lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '38' is written in pencil on the exterior surface. The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.397.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 62, p. 169, no. 195)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 785)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 988)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1952) (phase 2)
